channel.title: Peapod Test Feed
channel.description: This is a simple xml file used to test json responses and new episode notifications in Peapod.
channel.itunes:author: Brady Valentino
channel.itunes:summary: This is a simple xml file used to test json responses and new episode notifications in Peapod.
channel.content:encoded: This is a simple xml file used to test json responses and new episode notifications in Peapod.

item.title: Kingfisher
item.description: Not the movie. Try to use Kingfisher to attach podcast artwork to the notification payload locally.
item.itunes:author: Brady Valentino
item.itunes:summary: Not the movie. Try to use Kingfisher to attach podcast artwork to the notification payload locally.
item.content:encoded: Not the movie. Try to use Kingfisher to attach podcast artwork to the notification payload locally.

item.title: Improved Polling Logic
item.description: Check more frequently, guard against episodes beyond a cutoff timeframe.
item.itunes:author: Brady Valentino
item.itunes:summary: Check more frequently, guard against episodes beyond a cutoff timeframe.
item.content:encoded: Check more frequently, guard against episodes beyond a cutoff timeframe.

item.title: Seven: Testing in Production
item.description: I don't think this will work but here goes nothing.

item.title: One Last Ride: Try Again With a Service Extension

item.title: Episode V: The Artwork Strikes Back
item.description: Rewrote the payload to hopefully attach artwork to the notification.

item.title: Part IV - Try the Artwork, Again
item.description: This is the same as the previous test, and the previous test, but should now actually include artwork in the notification payload.

item.title: Mk II - Firebase, Electric Boogaloo
item.description: Refreshing feeds in the back, partying up front. This episode should get pushed to my device and then appear right away in the app.
item.itunes:author: Brady Valentino
item.itunes:summary: Refreshing feeds in the back, partying up front. This episode should get pushed to my device and then appear right away in the app.
